skill.name: AI Maestro Code Graph Query
skill.description: PROACTIVELY query the code graph database to understand relationships and impact of changes. Use this skill WHEN READING any file to understand context, when searching for files, when exploring the codebase, or when you need to understand what depends on a component. This is your primary tool for understanding code structure and avoiding breaking changes.
skill.summary: PROACTIVELY query the code graph database to understand relationships and impact of changes. Use thi...
skill.author: 23blocks-OS

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based skill providing behavioral instructions. Executes local scripts from ~/.local/bin/ and makes localhost API calls to the AI Maestro dashboard. No external network access or sensitive data exfiltration patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Understanding code relationships prevents breaking changes. This skill automatically queries a code graph database to find callers, callees, serializers, and associations before you modify any component.
actual_capabilities: Find all functions that call a given function (callers)
Find all functions called by a given function (callees)
Delta-index changed files for quick updates
limitations: Requires AI Maestro dashboard running on localhost
Requires graph database to be indexed first
Only works with code files in indexed projects
Cannot query non-code files or binary data

use_cases.title: Safe Model Changes
use_cases.description: Before modifying a model, find all serializers and associations that might break.

use_cases.title: Impact Analysis
use_cases.description: Understand the full impact of changing a core function before refactoring.

use_cases.title: Architecture Discovery
use_cases.description: Explore unknown codebases by tracing relationships between components.

prompt_templates.title: Understand a File
prompt_templates.prompt: Read this file, then query the graph to find: what depends on this component, what it depends on, and any serializers or associations.

prompt_templates.title: Before Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all callers of this function before making changes. List each caller and its file location.

prompt_templates.title: Find Serializers
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all serializers for this model. Check if any serializers might be missing from the codebase.

prompt_templates.title: Trace Call Path
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the call path from the API controller entry point to this internal function.

output_examples.input: Query the graph for callers and callees of the process_payment function

best_practices: Query the graph immediately after reading any code file to build context
Check serializers before modifying database models
Verify all callers before changing function signatures
Use delta indexing to keep the graph updated with changes
anti_patterns: Making modifications without checking for downstream effects
Assuming you understand the full impact without querying
Forgetting to update the graph index after major changes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It requires the AI Maestro dashboard to be running locally.

faq.question: How does the code graph get built?
faq.answer: The graph is built by indexing your codebase. Run graph-index-delta.sh to update it with changes.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with any language. Language detection depends on your AI Maestro installation configuration.

faq.question: Is my code data sent externally?
faq.answer: No. All graph data stays on your machine. The API calls are to localhost port 23000 only.

faq.question: Why are my queries returning no results?
faq.answer: The graph needs to be indexed first. Run graph-index-delta.sh on your project directory.

faq.question: How is this different from grep or search?
faq.answer: Graph queries understand relationships. Find all callers, not just text matches. Shows call paths and dependencies.
